metadata.title: 100 Most Impactful US Legislation (1900-2000)
metadata.description: A comprehensive collection of the most significant federal laws enacted in the United States during the 20th century

legislation.name: Antiquities Act
legislation.description: Authorized the President to designate national monuments on federal lands to protect significant natural, cultural, or scientific features.
key_provisions: Presidential authority to declare national monuments
Protection of objects of historic or scientific interest
Penalties for unauthorized excavation or destruction of antiquities
legislation.historical_impact: Enabled the creation of over 150 national monuments, protecting landmarks like the Grand Canyon before it became a national park.

legislation.name: Pure Food and Drug Act
legislation.description: Prohibited the manufacture, sale, or transportation of adulterated or misbranded foods and drugs in interstate commerce.
key_provisions: Created federal inspection and enforcement mechanisms
legislation.historical_impact: First major federal consumer protection law, laid groundwork for the FDA and modern food safety regulation.

legislation.name: Meat Inspection Act
legislation.description: Required federal inspection of meat processing facilities and mandated sanitary conditions.
key_provisions: Mandatory ante-mortem and post-mortem inspection of livestock
legislation.historical_impact: Transformed the meatpacking industry and established federal food safety standards still in effect today.

legislation.name: Federal Reserve Act
legislation.description: Created the Federal Reserve System, establishing a central banking system for the United States.
key_provisions: Authorized issuance of Federal Reserve notes
Established reserve requirements for member banks
legislation.historical_impact: Fundamentally restructured American banking and monetary policy, giving the government tools to manage economic cycles.

legislation.name: Sixteenth Amendment (Income Tax)
legislation.description: Constitutional amendment authorizing Congress to levy an income tax without apportioning it among the states.
key_provisions: Congressional power to tax incomes from any source
No requirement for apportionment based on state population
legislation.historical_impact: Enabled the modern federal income tax system, fundamentally changing how the federal government funds itself.

legislation.name: Clayton Antitrust Act
legislation.description: Strengthened antitrust laws by specifically prohibiting certain business practices and protecting labor unions.
key_provisions: Prohibited price discrimination, exclusive dealing, and tying arrangements
Exempted labor unions from antitrust prosecution
Allowed private parties to sue for triple damages
legislation.historical_impact: Clarified and strengthened the Sherman Antitrust Act, providing more effective tools against monopolistic practices.

legislation.name: Federal Trade Commission Act
legislation.description: Created the Federal Trade Commission to prevent unfair methods of competition and deceptive business practices.
key_provisions: Established the FTC as an independent agency
Power to issue cease and desist orders
legislation.historical_impact: Created a permanent federal agency dedicated to protecting consumers and maintaining competitive markets.

legislation.name: Seventeenth Amendment (Direct Election of Senators)
legislation.description: Established direct popular election of U.S. Senators, replacing selection by state legislatures.
key_provisions: Senators elected by the people of each state
Governor authority to make temporary appointments
State legislature can empower governor to fill vacancies
legislation.historical_impact: Democratized the Senate and reduced corruption associated with legislative selection of senators.

legislation.name: Eighteenth Amendment (Prohibition)
legislation.description: Prohibited the manufacture, sale, and transportation of alcoholic beverages in the United States.
key_provisions: Ban on production, sale, and transport of intoxicating liquors
legislation.historical_impact: Launched the Prohibition era, leading to unintended consequences including organized crime growth; repealed by 21st Amendment in 1933.

legislation.name: Nineteenth Amendment (Women's Suffrage)
legislation.description: Guaranteed women the right to vote, prohibiting denial of suffrage based on sex.
key_provisions: Right to vote cannot be denied based on sex
legislation.historical_impact: Doubled the eligible voting population and marked a major milestone in the women's rights movement.

legislation.name: National Origins Act (Immigration Act of 1924)
legislation.description: Established national origin quotas limiting immigration, particularly from Southern and Eastern Europe and banning Asian immigration.
key_provisions: 2% quota based on 1890 census national origins
Preference for Northern and Western Europeans
legislation.historical_impact: Dramatically reshaped immigration patterns until replaced by the Immigration Act of 1965; reflected nativist sentiment of the era.

legislation.name: Revenue Act of 1926
legislation.description: Reduced income tax rates and established the estate tax and gift tax as permanent features of the tax code.
key_provisions: Reduced top marginal income tax rate to 25%
legislation.historical_impact: Established the estate and gift tax framework that continues today; represented 1920s approach to taxation.

legislation.name: Norris-La Guardia Act
legislation.description: Limited federal courts' power to issue injunctions against labor unions and banned yellow-dog contracts.
key_provisions: Restricted federal court injunctions in labor disputes
Declared labor organization a matter of public policy
legislation.historical_impact: Major victory for organized labor; removed judicial obstacles to union organizing and collective bargaining.

legislation.name: Twenty-First Amendment (Repeal of Prohibition)
legislation.description: Repealed the Eighteenth Amendment, ending nationwide Prohibition of alcohol.
legislation.historical_impact: Only constitutional amendment to repeal another; ended the failed Prohibition experiment and restored state control over alcohol.

legislation.name: Emergency Banking Act
legislation.description: Provided for reopening of banks under federal supervision and Treasury assistance during the banking crisis.
key_provisions: Presidential authority to declare bank holidays
Federal Reserve authorized to issue emergency currency
Treasury could provide capital to troubled banks
legislation.historical_impact: Helped restore confidence in the banking system during the Great Depression; first major New Deal legislation.

legislation.name: Glass-Steagall Act (Banking Act of 1933)
legislation.description: Separated commercial and investment banking and created the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation.
key_provisions: Separation of commercial and investment banking
Creation of FDIC to insure bank deposits
Regulation of interest rates on deposits
legislation.historical_impact: Stabilized the banking system for decades; FDIC continues to protect depositors; separation provisions repealed in 1999.

legislation.name: Securities Act of 1933
legislation.description: Required registration of securities offerings and disclosure of material information to investors.
key_provisions: Liability for false or misleading statements
Exemptions for certain types of offerings
legislation.historical_impact: Foundation of modern securities regulation; restored investor confidence after 1929 crash.

legislation.name: Tennessee Valley Authority Act
legislation.description: Created the TVA as a federally owned corporation to provide flood control, electricity generation, and economic development in the Tennessee Valley.
key_provisions: Construction of dams and power plants
legislation.historical_impact: Transformed one of the poorest regions of the country; model for integrated regional development and public power.

legislation.name: National Industrial Recovery Act
legislation.description: Established the National Recovery Administration and guaranteed workers the right to organize unions.
key_provisions: Antitrust law suspension for code-compliant industries
legislation.historical_impact: Though struck down by Supreme Court in 1935, Section 7(a) inspired the Wagner Act and transformed labor relations.

legislation.name: Securities Exchange Act of 1934
legislation.description: Created the Securities and Exchange Commission and regulated secondary trading of securities.
key_provisions: Regulation of stock exchanges and broker-dealers
Periodic reporting requirements for public companies
Prohibition of market manipulation and insider trading
legislation.historical_impact: Created the modern framework for securities market regulation and investor protection.

legislation.name: Federal Communications Act
legislation.description: Created the Federal Communications Commission to regulate interstate and international communications.
key_provisions: Regulation of radio and telephone communications
Public interest standard for broadcast licenses
legislation.historical_impact: Established the regulatory framework for all electronic communications that continues to evolve today.

legislation.name: National Housing Act of 1934
legislation.description: Created the Federal Housing Administration to insure mortgage loans and stimulate the housing industry.
legislation.historical_impact: Revolutionized home ownership in America by making long-term, low-down-payment mortgages possible.

legislation.name: Social Security Act
legislation.description: Established the Social Security system providing old-age benefits, unemployment insurance, and aid to dependent children.
key_provisions: Aid to the blind and disabled
legislation.historical_impact: Created the foundation of the American social safety net; remains the largest government program today.

legislation.name: National Labor Relations Act (Wagner Act)
legislation.description: Guaranteed workers' rights to organize unions and bargain collectively, and established the National Labor Relations Board.
key_provisions: Right to organize and join unions
Prohibition of unfair labor practices by employers
legislation.historical_impact: Transformed American labor relations; led to dramatic growth in union membership and collective bargaining.

legislation.name: Rural Electrification Act
legislation.description: Created the Rural Electrification Administration to bring electricity to rural areas through low-interest loans.
key_provisions: Low-interest loans for rural electric cooperatives
legislation.historical_impact: Brought electricity to millions of rural Americans; by 1950, 90% of farms had electricity compared to 10% in 1935.

legislation.name: Fair Labor Standards Act
legislation.description: Established minimum wage, overtime pay requirements, and restrictions on child labor.
legislation.historical_impact: Established fundamental labor protections that continue today; minimum wage has been raised numerous times.

legislation.name: Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act
legislation.description: Overhauled food and drug regulation, requiring pre-market approval of new drugs and setting food standards.
key_provisions: Pre-market approval requirement for new drugs
legislation.historical_impact: Modernized FDA authority; became foundation for pharmaceutical and food safety regulation.

legislation.name: Hatch Act
legislation.description: Restricted political activities of federal employees to prevent use of government resources for political campaigns.
key_provisions: Prohibited federal employees from engaging in partisan political activities
Ban on using official authority to influence elections
Restrictions on political contributions by federal employees
legislation.historical_impact: Established the principle of a politically neutral civil service; remains in effect with modifications.

legislation.name: Smith Act (Alien Registration Act)
legislation.description: Required registration of aliens and made it a crime to advocate violent overthrow of the government.
key_provisions: Criminal penalties for advocating government overthrow
Prohibition on organizing groups advocating revolution
legislation.historical_impact: Used extensively during Cold War to prosecute Communist Party members; later limited by Supreme Court decisions.

legislation.name: Lend-Lease Act
legislation.description: Authorized the President to transfer defense materials to any country whose defense was vital to US security.
key_provisions: Presidential authority to lend or lease defense articles
Countries deemed vital to US defense eligible
Repayment in kind or other terms
legislation.historical_impact: Enabled massive US support for Allies before Pearl Harbor; provided over $50 billion in aid during WWII.

legislation.name: Servicemen's Readjustment Act (GI Bill)
legislation.description: Provided comprehensive benefits for returning WWII veterans including education, housing, and unemployment assistance.
legislation.historical_impact: Transformed American society by enabling millions of veterans to attend college and buy homes; created the modern middle class.

legislation.name: Employment Act of 1946
legislation.description: Declared federal responsibility for promoting maximum employment and created the Council of Economic Advisers.
key_provisions: Federal policy to promote maximum employment
Creation of Council of Economic Advisers
Annual Economic Report of the President
legislation.historical_impact: Established government responsibility for managing the economy; foundation of modern economic policy.

legislation.name: Administrative Procedure Act
legislation.description: Established procedures for federal agency rulemaking and adjudication, and standards for judicial review.
key_provisions: Right to judicial review of agency actions
Separation of prosecutorial and adjudicative functions
legislation.historical_impact: Foundation of modern administrative law; governs how all federal agencies operate and are held accountable.

legislation.name: National Security Act of 1947
legislation.description: Reorganized the military establishment, created the Department of Defense, CIA, and National Security Council.
key_provisions: Unification of military under Department of Defense
Creation of the Air Force as separate branch
legislation.historical_impact: Created the modern national security state; these institutions continue to shape US foreign and defense policy.

legislation.name: Taft-Hartley Act (Labor Management Relations Act)
legislation.description: Amended the Wagner Act to restrict union activities, prohibit closed shops, and allow states to pass right-to-work laws.
key_provisions: Ban on secondary boycotts and jurisdictional strikes
80-day cooling-off period for national emergency strikes
Anti-communist affidavits required of union leaders
legislation.historical_impact: Significantly limited union power and began the decline of organized labor; remains controversial.

legislation.name: Marshall Plan (Economic Cooperation Act)
legislation.description: Provided massive economic assistance for the reconstruction of Western Europe after World War II.
key_provisions: Over $12 billion in economic aid to Europe
Recipient countries required to cooperate on recovery
legislation.historical_impact: Rebuilt Western Europe, prevented communist expansion, and established US leadership in the postwar world.

legislation.name: Housing Act of 1949
legislation.description: Established national housing policy goal of a decent home for every American and expanded public housing and urban renewal programs.
key_provisions: Goal of 'a decent home' for every American family
Urban renewal and slum clearance programs
legislation.historical_impact: Major expansion of federal housing role; urban renewal programs later criticized for displacing minority communities.

legislation.name: Internal Security Act (McCarran Act)
legislation.description: Required registration of communist organizations and established the Subversive Activities Control Board.
key_provisions: Restrictions on communists' employment and travel
legislation.historical_impact: Epitomized Cold War anti-communist measures; most provisions later struck down or repealed.

legislation.name: Social Security Amendments of 1950
legislation.description: Dramatically expanded Social Security coverage and increased benefits.
key_provisions: Extended coverage to 10 million additional workers
Raised wage base and tax rates
legislation.historical_impact: Transformed Social Security from limited program to near-universal retirement system.

legislation.name: Immigration and Nationality Act of 1952 (McCarran-Walter Act)
legislation.description: Codified immigration law, retained national origins quotas, but eliminated racial bars to naturalization.
key_provisions: Consolidated immigration laws into single statute
Preference system for skills and family reunification
legislation.historical_impact: First major immigration codification; racial equality provisions significant though quotas remained discriminatory.

legislation.name: Twenty-Second Amendment (Presidential Term Limits)
legislation.description: Limited presidents to two terms in office, codifying the tradition broken by Franklin D. Roosevelt.
key_provisions: Partial terms over two years count toward limit
legislation.historical_impact: Constitutionalized the two-term tradition; has prevented several popular presidents from seeking additional terms.

legislation.name: Atomic Energy Act of 1954
legislation.description: Amended 1946 Act to allow private development of nuclear power while maintaining federal control over weapons.
key_provisions: Private ownership of nuclear reactors permitted
Licensing system for civilian nuclear power
legislation.historical_impact: Launched civilian nuclear power industry in the US; 'Atoms for Peace' program foundation.

legislation.name: Brown v. Board of Education Implementation Act
legislation.description: Supreme Court's Brown II decision requiring desegregation 'with all deliberate speed.'
key_provisions: Federal court oversight of desegregation plans
legislation.historical_impact: Though a court decision, it reshaped American education and civil rights; implementation faced massive resistance.

legislation.name: Federal-Aid Highway Act of 1956
legislation.description: Authorized construction of the Interstate Highway System, the largest public works project in American history.
legislation.historical_impact: Transformed American geography, economy, and culture; enabled suburbanization and automobile-centered development.

legislation.name: Civil Rights Act of 1957
legislation.description: First civil rights legislation since Reconstruction, focused on voting rights protection.
key_provisions: Created Civil Rights Division in Justice Department
Established U.S. Commission on Civil Rights
Federal authority to prosecute voting rights violations
legislation.historical_impact: Broke the legislative barrier to civil rights laws; though limited, opened door for stronger legislation.

legislation.name: National Defense Education Act
legislation.description: Provided federal funding for education in science, mathematics, and foreign languages after Sputnik launch.
key_provisions: Funding for science and math instruction
Foreign language and area studies programs
legislation.historical_impact: Marked major expansion of federal role in education; response to perceived Soviet technological advantage.

legislation.name: Labor-Management Reporting and Disclosure Act (Landrum-Griffin Act)
legislation.description: Established a bill of rights for union members and required financial reporting by unions.
key_provisions: Bill of rights for union members
Restrictions on ex-convicts holding union office
legislation.historical_impact: Addressed union corruption exposed by McClellan Committee; enhanced internal union democracy.

legislation.name: Civil Rights Act of 1960
legislation.description: Strengthened voting rights provisions and addressed obstruction of court orders in civil rights cases.
key_provisions: Federal inspection of voter registration records
Penalties for obstruction of court orders
Penalties for flight to avoid prosecution for bombing
legislation.historical_impact: Incremental progress on voting rights; set stage for more comprehensive 1964 and 1965 legislation.

legislation.name: Twenty-Third Amendment (DC Presidential Voting)
legislation.description: Granted citizens of Washington, D.C. the right to vote in presidential elections.
key_provisions: DC granted electoral votes equal to least populous state
Treated as a state for Electoral College purposes
legislation.historical_impact: Enfranchised DC residents in presidential elections; DC statehood remains an ongoing issue.

legislation.name: Peace Corps Act
legislation.description: Established the Peace Corps to promote world peace and friendship through volunteer service abroad.
legislation.historical_impact: Became iconic program of American idealism; over 240,000 volunteers have served in 142 countries.

legislation.name: Trade Expansion Act of 1962
legislation.description: Granted presidential authority to negotiate tariff reductions and established trade adjustment assistance.
key_provisions: Authority to cut tariffs up to 50%
Trade adjustment assistance for affected workers
Authority to eliminate tariffs on some products
legislation.historical_impact: Enabled Kennedy Round of GATT negotiations; established model for future trade authority legislation.

legislation.name: Equal Pay Act
legislation.description: Prohibited wage discrimination based on sex for equal work requiring equal skill, effort, and responsibility.
key_provisions: Equal pay for equal work regardless of sex
Amendment to Fair Labor Standards Act
Exceptions for seniority and merit systems
legislation.historical_impact: First federal law addressing gender-based wage discrimination; foundation for workplace equality efforts.

legislation.name: Clean Air Act of 1963
legislation.description: First federal legislation to address air pollution, providing research funding and enforcement authority.
key_provisions: Grants to states for pollution control
legislation.historical_impact: Beginning of federal air quality regulation; significantly strengthened by 1970 amendments.

legislation.name: Civil Rights Act of 1964
legislation.description: Landmark legislation prohibiting discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, or national origin in employment and public accommodations.
key_provisions: Title II: Desegregation of public accommodations
Title VI: Non-discrimination in federally funded programs
legislation.historical_impact: Most significant civil rights legislation in American history; transformed American society and law.

legislation.name: Economic Opportunity Act
legislation.description: Centerpiece of the War on Poverty, creating Job Corps, Head Start, VISTA, and Community Action Programs.
key_provisions: Job Corps for youth employment training
Head Start for early childhood education
legislation.historical_impact: Launched War on Poverty; many programs continue today including Head Start and community action agencies.

legislation.name: Twenty-Fourth Amendment (Poll Tax Prohibition)
legislation.description: Prohibited poll taxes in federal elections, removing a major barrier to voting for poor and minority citizens.
key_provisions: Prohibition of poll taxes in federal elections
legislation.historical_impact: Removed significant barrier to voting; Supreme Court extended ban to state elections in 1966.

legislation.name: Gulf of Tonkin Resolution
legislation.description: Authorized the President to use conventional military force in Southeast Asia without a formal declaration of war.
key_provisions: Presidential authority to use 'all necessary steps'
Determination of national interest by President
legislation.historical_impact: Legal basis for Vietnam War escalation; later seen as cautionary tale about congressional war powers.

legislation.name: Wilderness Act
legislation.description: Created the National Wilderness Preservation System to protect pristine federal lands from development.
key_provisions: Definition of wilderness as 'untrammeled by man'
Designation of 9.1 million acres of wilderness
Prohibition on roads, buildings, and motorized equipment
Congressional approval required for new designations
legislation.historical_impact: Protected over 111 million acres as wilderness; established principle of permanent land protection.

legislation.name: Social Security Amendments of 1965 (Medicare and Medicaid)
legislation.description: Created Medicare and Medicaid, providing health insurance for the elderly and low-income Americans.
key_provisions: Medicare Part A: Hospital insurance for elderly
Medicare Part B: Supplementary medical insurance
Medicaid: Federal-state health program for low-income
legislation.historical_impact: Largest expansion of social insurance since 1935; transformed healthcare for elderly and poor Americans.

legislation.name: Voting Rights Act of 1965
legislation.description: Prohibited racial discrimination in voting and authorized federal oversight of elections in covered jurisdictions.
key_provisions: Prohibited literacy tests and similar devices
Federal examiner authority in covered jurisdictions
legislation.historical_impact: Most effective civil rights legislation ever enacted; dramatically increased minority voter registration and participation.

legislation.name: Immigration and Nationality Act of 1965 (Hart-Celler Act)
legislation.description: Abolished national origins quota system and established preference-based immigration emphasizing family reunification and skills.
legislation.historical_impact: Fundamentally changed American immigration; led to dramatic diversification of immigrant origins.

legislation.name: Higher Education Act of 1965
legislation.description: Strengthened educational resources of colleges and provided financial assistance for students.
key_provisions: Federal scholarships and grants for students
legislation.historical_impact: Opened higher education to millions; federal student aid programs have since helped tens of millions attend college.

legislation.name: Elementary and Secondary Education Act
legislation.description: Provided federal funding for K-12 education, particularly for schools serving low-income students.
key_provisions: Title I funding for high-poverty schools
legislation.historical_impact: Established major federal role in K-12 education; Title I remains largest federal K-12 program.

legislation.name: Water Quality Act of 1965
legislation.description: Required states to establish water quality standards for interstate waters.
key_provisions: Federal Water Pollution Control Administration created
legislation.historical_impact: First comprehensive federal water quality legislation; precursor to Clean Water Act.

legislation.name: National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act
legislation.description: Established federal motor vehicle safety standards and created the predecessor to NHTSA.
legislation.historical_impact: Led to seatbelts, airbags, and countless safety improvements; significantly reduced traffic fatalities.

legislation.name: Freedom of Information Act
legislation.description: Established public right of access to federal government records with limited exemptions.
key_provisions: Presumption of public access to government records
legislation.historical_impact: Foundation of government transparency; enables citizens and journalists to access government information.

legislation.name: Fair Housing Act (Civil Rights Act of 1968)
legislation.description: Prohibited discrimination in sale, rental, and financing of housing based on race, religion, national origin, and sex.
key_provisions: Exemptions for small landlords and religious organizations
legislation.historical_impact: Addressed residential segregation; enforcement strengthened over time though housing discrimination persists.

legislation.name: Gun Control Act of 1968
legislation.description: Regulated firearms industry and owners, including prohibiting interstate sale of firearms and gun ownership by certain individuals.
key_provisions: Banned gun sales to felons and other prohibited persons
legislation.historical_impact: First major federal gun control since 1930s; remains foundation of federal firearms regulation.

legislation.name: National Environmental Policy Act
legislation.description: Required environmental impact statements for major federal actions and created the Council on Environmental Quality.
legislation.historical_impact: Foundation of modern environmental law; EIS process has influenced countless federal decisions.

legislation.name: Twenty-Sixth Amendment (Voting Age)
legislation.description: Lowered the voting age from 21 to 18 in all elections.
key_provisions: Right to vote cannot be denied to those 18 or older
Applies to federal, state, and local elections
legislation.historical_impact: Fastest-ratified amendment in history; added millions of young voters to electorate during Vietnam era.

legislation.name: Clean Air Act of 1970
legislation.description: Dramatically expanded federal authority over air pollution, establishing National Ambient Air Quality Standards and mobile source controls.
legislation.historical_impact: Cornerstone of environmental regulation; has significantly improved air quality nationwide.

legislation.name: Occupational Safety and Health Act
legislation.description: Created OSHA to ensure safe and healthy working conditions through standards setting and enforcement.
legislation.historical_impact: Transformed workplace safety; workplace fatalities have declined dramatically since enactment.

legislation.name: Controlled Substances Act
legislation.description: Established federal drug policy, creating five schedules for drug classification and regulation.
legislation.historical_impact: Foundation of federal drug enforcement; continues to govern drug policy and enforcement.

legislation.name: Federal Election Campaign Act
legislation.description: Required disclosure of federal campaign contributions and expenditures and established contribution limits.
key_provisions: Disclosure of campaign contributions and expenditures
legislation.historical_impact: Foundation of modern campaign finance law; significantly modified by Supreme Court decisions.

legislation.name: Title IX of Education Amendments
legislation.description: Prohibited sex discrimination in federally funded education programs and activities.
key_provisions: No sex-based exclusion from educational programs
Applies to all federally funded education activities
legislation.historical_impact: Revolutionized women's opportunities in education and athletics; women's sports participation increased dramatically.

legislation.name: Clean Water Act (Federal Water Pollution Control Act Amendments)
legislation.description: Established comprehensive federal water pollution control, including the NPDES permit system and technology-based standards.
legislation.historical_impact: Dramatically improved water quality nationwide; wetlands protection has been particularly significant.

legislation.name: Consumer Product Safety Act
legislation.description: Created the Consumer Product Safety Commission to develop safety standards and protect consumers from hazardous products.
legislation.historical_impact: Established comprehensive consumer product safety regulation; has recalled thousands of dangerous products.

legislation.name: Equal Employment Opportunity Act
legislation.description: Strengthened the EEOC by giving it litigation authority and extending coverage to state and local governments.
key_provisions: Coverage extended to state and local governments
legislation.historical_impact: Made EEOC an effective enforcement agency; significantly expanded workplace discrimination protections.

legislation.name: Endangered Species Act
legislation.description: Protected endangered and threatened species and their habitats through listing, critical habitat designation, and take prohibition.
key_provisions: Listing process for endangered and threatened species
legislation.historical_impact: One of the world's strongest wildlife protection laws; has prevented numerous extinctions.

legislation.name: Rehabilitation Act of 1973
legislation.description: Prohibited discrimination against people with disabilities in federal programs and by federal contractors.
legislation.historical_impact: First federal civil rights protection for disabled individuals; precursor to the ADA.

legislation.name: War Powers Resolution
legislation.description: Limited presidential war-making authority by requiring congressional notification and approval for military deployments.
legislation.historical_impact: Attempted to reassert congressional war powers; effectiveness debated but shapes military deployment decisions.

legislation.name: Employee Retirement Income Security Act (ERISA)
legislation.description: Established minimum standards for private pension plans and created the Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation.
key_provisions: Vesting and funding standards for pensions
legislation.historical_impact: Protects retirement benefits for millions of workers; PBGC insures defined benefit plans.

legislation.name: Privacy Act of 1974
legislation.description: Established rules for federal agencies' collection, maintenance, and disclosure of personal information.
key_provisions: Individual access to records about themselves
Right to request amendment of records
legislation.historical_impact: Foundation of federal privacy protection; balances government information needs with individual privacy.

legislation.name: Safe Drinking Water Act
legislation.description: Established national standards for drinking water quality and protection of underground sources.
legislation.historical_impact: Ensures safe drinking water for most Americans; continues to address emerging contaminants.

legislation.name: Education for All Handicapped Children Act
legislation.description: Required public schools to provide free appropriate public education to children with disabilities.
legislation.historical_impact: Transformed education for disabled children; now known as IDEA, serves millions of students.

legislation.name: Tax Reform Act of 1976
legislation.description: Major tax reform addressing estate taxes, tax shelters, and individual provisions.
key_provisions: Unified estate and gift tax system
legislation.historical_impact: Addressed many tax avoidance strategies; set stage for later comprehensive tax reform.

legislation.name: Resource Conservation and Recovery Act
legislation.description: Established framework for management of hazardous and non-hazardous solid waste.
key_provisions: Treatment, storage, and disposal facility standards
legislation.historical_impact: Controls hazardous waste from generation to disposal; prevents future Superfund sites.

legislation.name: Toxic Substances Control Act
legislation.description: Authorized EPA to require testing and regulate chemical substances entering the environment.
legislation.historical_impact: First comprehensive regulation of chemical substances; reformed in 2016 to strengthen authority.

legislation.name: Community Reinvestment Act
legislation.description: Required banks to meet the credit needs of their entire communities, including low- and moderate-income neighborhoods.
key_provisions: Affirmative obligation to serve community credit needs
Consideration in merger and acquisition approvals
legislation.historical_impact: Addressed redlining and credit discrimination; has leveraged billions in community investment.

legislation.name: Foreign Corrupt Practices Act
legislation.description: Prohibited bribery of foreign officials and required accurate recordkeeping by public companies.
legislation.historical_impact: First law worldwide to criminalize foreign bribery; model for international anti-corruption efforts.

legislation.name: Airline Deregulation Act
legislation.description: Removed federal control over airline fares, routes, and market entry, phasing out the Civil Aeronautics Board.
legislation.historical_impact: Transformed airline industry; fares dropped dramatically, service expanded, though consolidation followed.

legislation.name: Pregnancy Discrimination Act
legislation.description: Amended Title VII to prohibit sex discrimination on the basis of pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions.
legislation.historical_impact: Established pregnancy as protected status; foundation for workplace pregnancy accommodations.

legislation.name: Ethics in Government Act
legislation.description: Created financial disclosure requirements for federal officials and the Office of Government Ethics.
legislation.historical_impact: Response to Watergate; established framework for government ethics that continues today.

legislation.name: Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act (Superfund)
legislation.description: Created liability scheme and trust fund for cleanup of hazardous waste sites.
key_provisions: Strict, joint and several liability for cleanup
National Priorities List of contaminated sites
legislation.historical_impact: Has funded cleanup of thousands of contaminated sites; 'polluter pays' principle established.

legislation.name: Economic Recovery Tax Act of 1981
legislation.description: Major tax reduction including across-the-board income tax rate cuts and accelerated depreciation for business.
key_provisions: 23% reduction in income tax rates over three years
legislation.historical_impact: Largest tax cut in American history at the time; cornerstone of Reagan economic policy.

legislation.name: Immigration Reform and Control Act
legislation.description: Provided amnesty for certain undocumented immigrants while establishing employer sanctions for hiring illegal workers.
key_provisions: Employer sanctions for knowingly hiring unauthorized workers
legislation.historical_impact: Legalized approximately 3 million people; employer sanctions proved difficult to enforce.

legislation.name: Tax Reform Act of 1986
legislation.description: Comprehensive tax reform that lowered rates, broadened the base, and eliminated many tax shelters.
legislation.historical_impact: Most comprehensive tax reform since 1954; established template for revenue-neutral reform.

legislation.name: Americans with Disabilities Act
legislation.description: Comprehensive civil rights law prohibiting discrimination against people with disabilities in employment, public services, and public accommodations.
legislation.historical_impact: Most significant expansion of civil rights since 1960s; transformed accessibility across American society.

legislation.name: Clean Air Act Amendments of 1990
legislation.description: Major overhaul addressing acid rain, urban air pollution, toxic air emissions, and ozone depletion.
legislation.historical_impact: Demonstrated market-based environmental policy; acid rain program highly successful.

legislation.name: Family and Medical Leave Act
legislation.description: Required employers to provide unpaid, job-protected leave for family and medical reasons.
key_provisions: 12 weeks unpaid leave for qualifying reasons
Birth, adoption, or foster care of child
Serious health condition of family member
Continuation of health benefits during leave
legislation.historical_impact: First federal mandate for family leave; millions have used FMLA protections since enactment.
